did.abstract: A letter, ca. 1827, to Thomas Evans, copies of scattered entries from the minutes of Morning Meetings of the Society of Friends in London, 1692-1709, concerning the reading and publication of works by Stephen Crisp, Thomas Ellwood, George Fox, William Penn, and George Whitehead. Among those who attended the meetings and assisted with the readings were Thomas Lower, Charles Marshall, William Mead, Ambrose Rigg, John Tomkins, and Joseph Wyeth.
